name: Authentic Korean Bibimbap
steps:
Cook rice according to package instructions and keep warm.
Blanch spinach in boiling water for 30 seconds, then immediately transfer to ice water. Squeeze out excess water and season with 1 teaspoon sesame oil, 1 teaspoon soy sauce, and minced garlic.
Blanch bean sprouts in boiling water for 2 minutes, drain, and season with 1 teaspoon sesame oil, 1 teaspoon soy sauce, and a pinch of salt.
Heat a small amount of vegetable oil in a pan. Sauté julienned carrot for 2-3 minutes until slightly softened. Season with a pinch of salt.
In the same pan, sauté julienned zucchini for 2-3 minutes until tender. Season with salt.
Sauté sliced mushrooms until golden brown and tender. Season with 1 teaspoon soy sauce.
If using ground beef, cook in a pan with 1 tablespoon soy sauce and 1 teaspoon sugar until browned.
Fry eggs sunny-side up in a non-stick pan.
To make the sauce: mix gochujang with 1 tablespoon sesame oil, rice vinegar, and 1 teaspoon sugar.
To assemble: Place warm rice in the bottom of each bowl.
Arrange vegetables (spinach, bean sprouts, carrot, zucchini, mushrooms) in separate sections on top of the rice.
Add ground beef (if using) in the center.
Top with a fried egg.
Drizzle with gochujang sauce and remaining sesame oil.
Garnish with sesame seeds and green onions.
Mix everything together thoroughly before eating.
